_meanings:
{@--1@} A piece
of waste or uncultivated land,
desert or bare soil; a desert, waste.

{@--3@} An
additional hymn appended to the
regular collection; <ls>Ms. 3. 232.</ls>

<ab>N.</ab> of Brahmā
and of Viṣṇu. [{#Kila#} is often used in
combination with {#BU#} and {#kf#}; (1) {#KilIBU#}
({%a%}) to become impassable, to be
blocked up, be left unfrequented;
{#KilIBUte vimAnAnAM tadApAtaBayAtpaTi#}
<ls>Ku. 2. 45.</ls> ({%b%}) to be impossible, be
rendered impracticable or stopped;
{#prajAgarAtKilIBUtaratasyAH svaptasamAgamaH#}  
<ls>Ś. 6. 21.</ls> (2) {#KilIkf#} means ({%a%}) to 
obstruct, impede, make impassable,
block up; <ls>R. 11. 14</ls>, <ls n="R. 11.">87.</ls> ({%b%}) to lay
waste, devastate, put down or 
vanquish completely; {#vipakzamaKilIkftya#}
{#pratizWA Kalu durlaBA#} <ls>Śi. 2. 34.</ls>]
